Reses Legislator, Sebagian Warga Bengkulu Keluhkan Kenaikan Iuran BPJS Kesehatan
04 Nov 2019, 19:28 by Roki EP


Reses Legislator, Sebagian Warga Bengkulu Keluhkan Kenaikan Iuran BPJS Kesehatan

KBRN, Bengkulu : Hasil reses menjaring aspirasi masyarakat Kota Bengkulu yang menjadi Daerah Pemilihan (Dapil)-nya, Anggota Komisi I DPRD Provinsi Bengkulu Sefty Yuslinah menyebutkan, salah satu keluhan yang disampaikan konstituen,terkait kenaikan iuran bulanan BPJS sebesar 100 persen yang dirasa sangat memberatkan masyarakat.
“Aspirasi masyarakat kota Bengkulu itu, akan disampaikan dalam paripurna DPRD Provinsi Bengkulu penyampaian hasil reses. Jika perlu, juga melalui rekomendasi yang disampaikan pihak legislatif daerah nantinya ke pusat, agar pemerintah dapat mengkaji kembali kebijakan bidang kesehatantersebut,” kata Sefty, Senin, (4/11/2019).
Ditegaskan Anggota DPRD Provinsi Bengkulu dari PKS ini, secara umum sikap partainya mulai dari pusat hingga di daerah, memang menolak kenaikan iuran dimaksud.Mengingat kenaikan iuran BPJS itu, semestinya pemerintah terlebih dahulu dapat melihat kemampuan masyarakat.
“Hendaknya pemerintah jangan serta merta menaikannya, tetapi sebaiknya dikaji dulu secara komprehensif,karena sekarang masyarakat juga yang mengeluh,” ucapnya.
Dibagian lain ditambahkan Sefty Yuslinah, selain masalah iuran BPJS, juga masih banyak mendapat masukan terkait sarana dan parasarana public lainnya, baik soal penerangan lampu jalan, perbaikan jalan dan wilayah cagar budaya yang berbatasan langsung dengan lahan milik warga.
Kemudian juga masalah pendidikan, kesehatan hingga persoalan banjir yang sering melanda wilayah Kota Bengkulu, terutama ketika musim hujan telah datang.
“Setiap aspirasi yang disampaikan masyarakat ini pasti akan ditindak lanjuti sekaligus dikawalnya agar bisa direalisasikan oleh Pemerintah maupun Pemerintah Daerah setempat nantinya,” tutupnya.

Legislator Recess, Some Bengkulu Residents Complained about Increasing Health BPJS Contribution
Nov. 04, 2019, 19:28 by Roki EP


Legislator Recess, Some Bengkulu Residents Complained about Increasing Health BPJS Contribution

KBRN, Bengkulu: The recess results captured the aspirations of the people of Bengkulu City who became their Electoral District (Dapil), Bengkulu Province DPRD Commission I Sefty Yuslinah said, one of the complaints made by the constituents, related to the increase in BPJS monthly contributions by 100 percent which was considered very burdensome Public.
"The aspirations of the people of the city of Bengkulu, will be conveyed in the plenary of the Bengkulu Province DPRD submitting the results of the recess. If necessary, also through the recommendations submitted by the regional legislature later to the center, so that the government can review the health sector policy, "said Sefty, Monday (11/04/2019).
The Bengkulu Province DPRD member from the PKS asserted, in general the attitude of his party from the center to the regions, indeed refused the increase in fees referred.
"The government should not immediately raise it, but it should be studied first comprehensively, because now the public is also complaining," he said.
In another section added Sefty Yuslinah, in addition to the issue of BPJS fees, there are still many inputs related to other public facilities and infrastructure, both in terms of street lighting, road improvement and cultural heritage areas which are directly adjacent to residents' land.
Then also the problem of education, health to the problem of floods that often hit the Bengkulu City area, especially when the rainy season has come.
"Every aspiration conveyed by this community will definitely be followed up at the same time as they are escorted so that it can be realized by the Government and the local Regional Government later," he concluded.
